contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=February 2008}} {{japanese name|Fukuchi}} [[Image:Genichiro Fukuchi 3.jpg|thumb|Journalist days]] {{nihongo|'''Fukuchi Gen'ichirō'''|福地 源一郎||May 13, 1841 - January 4, 1906}} was a [[Japanese people|Japanese]] critic and author, also known under the pseudonym {{nihongo|'''Fukuchi Ōchi'''|福地 桜痴||}}. ==Biography== Fukuchi was born in [[Nagasaki]], [[Japan]]. He traveled [[Europe]] as a [[translation|translator]], and in 1874, became a main writer for the [[Tokyo Nichi Nichi Shimbun]] newspaper. In 1882, he formed the [[Rikken Teiseitō|Constitutional Imperial Rule Party]]. {{Commons|Fukuchi Genichiro}} {{Persondata | NAME = Fukuchi Genichiro | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 1841 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 1906 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Fukuchi, Genichiro}} [[Category:Japanese writers]] [[Category:1841 births]] [[Category:1906 deaths]] {{Japan-writer-stub}}
